info.title: Fynd Platform's Partner Side APIs v2.7.0

post.summary: completeUpload | This will complete the upload process. After successfully uploading file, you can call this operation to complete the upload process.
post.description:
Uploads an arbitrarily sized buffer or blob.

It has three Major Steps:
* Start
* Upload
* Complete

### Start
Initiates the assets upload using `startUpload`.
It returns the storage link in response.

### Upload
Use the storage link to upload a file (Buffer or Blob) to the File Storage.
Make a `PUT` request on storage link received from `startUpload` api with file (Buffer or Blob) as a request body.

### Complete
After successfully upload, call `completeUpload` api to complete the upload process.
This operation will return the url for the uploaded file.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Segregation of different types of files(products, orders, logistics etc), Required for validating the data of the file being uploaded, decides where exactly the file will be stored inside the storage bucket.

400.description: cdn is not passed correctly

namespace.name: ValidatorError
namespace.message: `test123` is not a valid enum value for path `namespace`.

properties.message: `test123` is not a valid enum value for path `namespace`.

value.name: ValidationError
value.message: Assets validation failed: namespace: `test123` is not a valid enum value for path `namespace`.

post.summary: startUpload | This operation initiates upload and returns storage link which is valid for 30 Minutes. You can use that storage link to make subsequent upload request with file buffer or blob.
post.description:
Uploads an arbitrarily sized buffer or blob.

It has three Major Steps:
* Start
* Upload
* Complete

### Start
Initiates the assets upload using `startUpload`.
It returns the storage link in response.

### Upload
Use the storage link to upload a file (Buffer or Blob) to the File Storage.
Make a `PUT` request on storage link received from `startUpload` api with file (Buffer or Blob) as a request body.

### Complete
After successfully upload, call `completeUpload` api to complete the upload process.
This operation will return the url for the uploaded file.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: Segregation of different types of files(products, orders, logistics etc), Required for validating the data of the file being uploaded, decides where exactly the file will be stored inside the storage bucket.

200.description: Success. Returns a response containing relaving and absolute_url of storage service

400.description: Missing or incorrect required field

parameters.description: The search string to search in the list of countries by name.

parameters.description: The search filter to filter countries based on their available hierarchy.

400.description: Unsuccessful Request

max.description: Maximum allowed size (in bytes) for files in the namespace

valid_content_types.description: List of valid content types for the namespace

file_acl.description: Access control level for files in the namespace

CreatedBy.description: Represents the user or system responsible for creating the object. It contains an identifier to track the creator.

id.description: Identifier of the user or system that created the object.

SignedUrl.description: Object containing the structure for URLs related to file access, including both the original and signed URLs along with their expiry details.

url.description: This is the original asset URL provided in the request. This is the URL for which a signed URL has been generated.

expiry.description: The expiration time for the signed URL in seconds.

SignUrlResult.description: This encapsulates the signed URLs generated for secure file access.

expiry.description: The expiration time for the signed URL.

urls.description: List of asset URLs to be signed.

Page.description: An object representing a page with pagination details.

item_total.description: The total number of all items across all pages.

next_id.description: The identifier for the next page.

has_previous.description: Indicates whether there is a previous page.

has_next.description: Indicates whether there is a next page.

type.description: The type of the page, such as 'PageType'.

size.description: The number of items per page.

page_size.description: The number of items per page.

source.description: Denotes if the ticket was created at partner or application level

status.description: Denotes in what state is the ticket

AgentChangePayload.description: Details of support staff to whom ticket is assigned

Filter.description: All the filters available for tickets

priorities.description: List of possible priorities for tickets

categories.description: List of possible categories for tickets

statuses.description: List of possible statuses for tickets

assignees.description: List of support staff availble for tickets assignment

application_id.description: Application ID related to the ticket

partner_id.description: Partner ID related to the ticket

CreatedOn.description: Gives details of when the form was created

attachments.description: List of all attachments related to the ticket

_custom_json.description: optional custom data that needs to be sent

inputs.description: Input details for the feed back form

title.description: Title for the feed back form

timestamps.description: Gives details of category releted data

group_id.description: Group id of category releted data

created_by.description: User who created the history event

_id.description: Unique identifier of the history event

updated_at.description: Time of last update of the history event

created_at.description: Time of creation of the history event

response_id.description: Details of partner and application realated to the ticket

assigned_to.description: Details of support staff to whom ticket is assigned

_custom_json.description: custom json relevant to the ticket

is_feedback_pending.description: Denotes if feedback submission is pending for the ticket

integration.description: Integration type and its details of the ticket

updated_at.description: Time when the ticket was last updated

created_at.description: Time when the ticket was created

created_on.description: The timestamp when the record was created.

modified_on.description: The timestamp when the record last modified.

extension_id.description: Unique identifier of courier partner extension.

scheme_id.description: Unique identifier for the scheme, used to fetch or modify scheme details.

company_id.description: The unique identifier of the company.

transport_type.description: Mode of transport associated with the courier partner scheme.

region.description: Serviceable region associated with the courier partner scheme.

delivery_type.description: Type of delivery associated with the courier partner scheme.

payment_mode.description: Mode of payment associated with the courier partner scheme.

stage.description: Indicates if the courier partner scheme is currently active or inactive.

status_updates.description: Describes the type of status updates provided by the courier partner (e.g., real-time, periodic).

ndr_attempts.description: Indicates if the Non-Delivery Report (NDR) feature is supported by the courier partner.

qc_shipment_item_quantity.description: Defines the maximum quantity of items allowed in a quality check shipment.

non_qc_shipment_item_quantity.description: Defines the maximum quantity of items allowed in a non-quality check shipment.

BulkRegionServiceabilityTatDetails.description: Details for bulk serviceability or TAT operations, specifying country and region.

type.description: Type of operation, either serviceability or TAT.

region.description: Name of the region for which the tat/serviceability file needs to be downloaded.

batch_id.description: A unique identifier for the performed batch operation.

error.description: An array of items referencing the ErrorResult schema, which likely contains detailed information about the errors.

items.description: Array of bulk region serviceability or TAT result items.
An array that contains items of region tat.
An array that contains items of region serviceability.

pickup_cutoff.description: Time of day by which pickups must be scheduled to be processed on the same day.

country_code.description: ISO2 code representing the country where the serviceability is being specified.

state_code.description: Code representing the state or province within the country where the serviceability is being specified.

city_code.description: Code representing the city within the state where the serviceability is being specified.

sector_code.description: Code representing a specific sector or district within the city where the serviceability is being specified.

pincode.description: A string indicating the postal code or PIN code of the address area.

first_mile.description: Boolean value indicating whether first-mile service is available or not.

last_mile.description: Boolean value indicating whether last-mile service is available or not.

cod_limit.description: Limit on the amount of cash on delivery (COD) payments allowed in the specified region.

prepaid_limit.description: Limit on the amount of prepaid payments allowed in the specified region.

doorstep_return.description: Indicates if doorstep return service is available. This refers to the ability to return items directly from the customer's doorstep.

doorstep_qc.description: Indicates if doorstep quality check service is available. This refers to the ability to perform quality checks on items at the customer's doorstep.

forward_pickup_cutoff.description: Time of day by which pickups must be scheduled to be processed on the same day in the forward journey.

reverse_pickup_cutoff.description: Time of day by which pickups must be scheduled to be processed on the same day in the reverse journey.

hand_to_hand_exchange.description: Indicates whether the product exchange happens directly between the buyer and seller (e.g., in person), instead of through a third-party service.

holiday_list.description: List of holidays for a courier partner scheme.

reverse_pickup.description: Boolean value indicating whether reverse pickup services is available.

installation.description: Boolean value indicating whether installation services are available in the specified region or not.

country.description: Country involved in the bulk operation.

CourierAccountDetailsBody.description: Represents the details of a courier account, including information about the associated extension, scheme, self-shipping status, and the account’s stage.

extension_id.description: The unique identifier for the extension linked to the courier account.

account_id.description: The unique identifier for the courier account.

scheme_id.description: The identifier for the scheme associated with the courier account.

is_self_ship.description: Indicates whether the courier account supports self-shipping (true if it does, false otherwise).

stage.description: The current stage of the courier account, either 'enabled' or 'disabled'.

is_own_account.description: Indicates whether the courier account is an own account (true if it is, false otherwise).

items.description: An array containing multiple instances of CourierAccountResult, which details individual courier accounts.

CourierAccountResult.description: This object represents the details of a courier account, including various properties that define the account's characteristics and operational parameters.

account_id.description: A string that uniquely identifies the courier account.

company_id.description: The unique identifier of the company.

scheme_id.description: A string that specifies the unique identifier for the scheme associated with the account

extension_id.description: A string that uniquely identifies the courier partner extension.

is_self_ship.description: A boolean indicating whether the account is for self-shipping.

stage.description: A string indicating the current stage of the account, which can be either enabled or disabled.

is_own_account.description: A boolean indicating whether the account is owned by the company.

extension_id.description: Unique identifier of courier partner extension.

scheme_id.description: Unique identifier for the scheme, used to fetch or modify scheme details.

default_forward_pickup_cutoff.description: Default cutoff time for forward pickup (nullable).

default_reverse_pickup_cutoff.description: Default cutoff time for reverse pickup (nullable).

transport_type.description: Mode of transport associated with the courier partner scheme.

region.description: Serviceable region associated with the courier partner scheme.

delivery_type.description: Type of delivery associated with the courier partner scheme.

payment_mode.description: Mode of payment associated with the courier partner scheme.

stage.description: Indicates if the courier partner scheme is currently active or inactive.

status_updates.description: Describes the type of status updates provided by the courier partner (e.g., real-time, periodic).

ndr_attempts.description: Indicates if the Non-Delivery Report (NDR) feature is supported by the courier partner.

qc_shipment_item_quantity.description: Defines the maximum quantity of items allowed in a quality check shipment.

non_qc_shipment_item_quantity.description: Defines the maximum quantity of items allowed in a non-quality check shipment.

extension_id.description: Unique identifier of courier partner extension.

created_on.description: The timestamp when the record was created.

modified_on.description: The timestamp when the record last modified.

GetCountries.description: Represents the result of a request for a list of countries, including details of each country and pagination information for navigating through large sets of data.

items.description: A list of country objects containing detailed information about each country.

max_delivery_time.description: Maximum time required for delivery from the origin to the destination in seconds.

min_delivery_time.description: Minimum time required for delivery from the origin to the destination in seconds.

message.description: A brief description of the error.

errors.description: A list of validation errors in the request.

ModifiedBy.description: Represents the user or system responsible for the most recent modification of the object. It contains an identifier to track the last modifier.

id.description: Identifier of the user or system that created the object.

ArithmeticOperations.description: Represents a set of arithmetic comparison operations with possible values for less than (lt), greater than (gt), less than or equal to (lte), and greater than or equal to (gte). Each operation can be nullable to indicate the absence of that specific comparison.

lt.description: Specifies a less than operation, comparing values smaller than the provided value.

gt.description: Specifies a greater than operation, comparing values larger than the provided value.

lte.description: Specifies a less than or equal to operation, comparing values smaller than or equal to the provided value.

gte.description: Specifies a greater than or equal to operation, comparing values larger than or equal to the provided value.

CourierPartnerSchemeFeatures.description: Detailed collection of all the features for a scheme.

doorstep_qc.description: Indicates if the courier partner offers doorstep quality check services.

qr.description: Specifies whether the courier partner supports QR code-based operations.

mps.description: Denotes if the courier partner supports multi-part shipment services.

ndr.description: Indicates if the Non-Delivery Report (NDR) feature is supported by the courier partner.

ndr_attempts.description: Number of attempts allowed for resolving Non-Delivery Reports (NDR).

dangerous_goods.description: Specifies if the courier partner handles the transportation of dangerous goods.

fragile_goods.description: Indicates whether the courier partner manages the shipment of fragile goods.

restricted_goods.description: Indicates if the courier partner handles restricted goods, as per regulatory guidelines.

cold_storage_goods.description: Denotes if the courier partner provides cold storage facilities for goods.

doorstep_exchange.description: Indicates if the courier partner supports doorstep exchange services.

doorstep_return.description: Specifies if the courier partner offers doorstep return services.

product_installation.description: Indicates if the courier partner provides product installation services upon delivery.

openbox_delivery.description: Specifies whether the courier partner supports open-box delivery, allowing customers to inspect goods before accepting.

status_updates.description: Describes the type of status updates provided by the courier partner (e.g., real-time, periodic).

multi_pick_single_drop.description: Indicates if the courier partner supports multiple pickups to a single drop location.

single_pick_multi_drop.description: Indicates whether the courier partner supports single pickup to multiple drop locations.

multi_pick_multi_drop.description: Denotes if the courier partner offers services for multiple pickups to multiple drop locations.

ewaybill.description: Specifies if the courier partner requires or supports the generation of e-waybills for shipments.

qc_shipment_item_quantity.description: Defines the maximum quantity of items allowed in a quality check shipment.

non_qc_shipment_item_quantity.description: Defines the maximum quantity of items allowed in a non-quality check shipment.

Error.description: Represents an error response with a type, value, and message.

value.description: The value associated with the error.

message.description: The error message describing the issue.

max_delivery_time.description: Maximum time required for delivery from the origin to the destination in seconds.

min_delivery_time.description: Minimum time required for delivery from the origin to the destination in seconds.

CourierPartnerSchemeModel.description: This object represents the configuration details for a courier partner scheme. It includes various properties that define the characteristics and operational parameters of the scheme.

extension_id.description: Unique identifier of courier partner extension.

scheme_id.description: A string representing the unique identifier for the scheme. This is a required field.

name.description: A string that specifies the name of the scheme. This is a required field.

transport_type.description: A string that specifies the type of transport.

region.description: A string that indicates the region type.

delivery_type.description: A string that defines the delivery type.

payment_mode.description: An array of strings specifying the payment modes available.

stage.description: A string indicating the current stage of the scheme.

CourierPartnerSchemeDefaultTat.description: Default turn around time (tat) for a scheme.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the default turn around time (tat) to be used for the given scheme or not.

CourierPartnerSchemeTat.description: Default turn around time (tat) values for a scheme.

min.description: Minimum turn around time (tat) value for a scheme.

max.description: Maximum turn around time (tat) value for a scheme.

unit.description: Unit for the turn around time (tat) values for a scheme.

id.description: A string serving as the unique identifier.

sub_type.description: A category for classifying the country into a specific subtype.

uid.description: A globally unique identifier for the country.

name.description: The official or widely recognized name of the country used in general contexts.

iso2.description: The 2-letter ISO code for the country.

iso3.description: The 3-letter ISO code for the country.

timezones.description: A list of timezones associated with the country.

hierarchy.description: A hierarchical list of items representing organizational levels within the country.

type.description: The type or classification of the country (e.g., sovereign or dependent).

latitude.description: The latitude of the central point of the country.

longitude.description: The longitude of the central point of the country.

display_name.description: A user-friendly name for the country, typically for display purposes.

has_next_hierarchy.description: A boolean indicating whether additional hierarchical regions or divisions are present.

name.description: The name of the item as displayed to the user, usually in a UI or listing.

display_name.description: It represent a country display name.

slug.description: A slug is a human-readable URL segment, typically generated from a title with special characters removed.

CurrencyObject.description: This object represents currency details, including the currency code, name, and symbol.

code.description: A string representing the currency code.

name.description: A string representing the currency name.

symbol.description: A string representing the currency symbol.

message.description: A brief description of the error encountered.

field.description: The field in the request that caused the error.

created_at.description: The creation timestamp of the page

updated_at.description: The last update timestamp of the page

Action.description: Schema to define the Action Object

type.description: Type of action to be taken e.g, page.

id.description: The source id specifying the source of the section.

bundle_name.description: This is the extension binding name containing this section.

type.description: This is source type. It will either be themeBundle or extension.

SectionSource.description: An object defining source details for the section.

AvailablePagePlatformPredicate.description: An object of platform values enabled for the section

zones.description: An array of zone ids associated with the section

industry.description: Industries the theme is suitable for

is_update.description: Indicates if the theme is an update

is_default.description: Indicates if the theme is a default theme

description.example: An exquisite fusion of elegance and functionality, designed to captivate the fashion-conscious. This visually enchanting and user-friendly option seamlessly harmonizes style and ease of use. Boasting optimised speed and search engine optimisation (SEO), it ensures a remarkable website that enthrals visitors while securing high rankings on search engines.

is_paid.description: Indicates if the theme is paid

description.example: Choose how transparent or translucent they want the colour to appear in their design or interface. Gala provides greater flexibility and creative possibilities in customising the appearance of elements within the theme, allowing for stunning visual effects and seamless integration with different backgrounds or elements.
Immerse yourself in an improved visual experience with full-screen image previews, thanks to a responsive layout, customisable features, and quantity control op

status.description: The status of the theme (e.g., rejected)

updated_at.description: The date and time when the theme rejection reasons object was last updated

message.description: Message Explaining what the issue is

applied.description: Whether the theme has been applied or not

is_private.description: Whether the theme is private or not

tags.description: An array of tags associated with the theme

marketplace_theme_id.description: The ID of the theme in the marketplace

template_theme_id.description: The ID of the template theme

styles.description: The styles associated with the theme

updated_at.description: The last update timestamp of the theme

company_id.description: The company id in which sales channel exists

name.description: The name of the font variant

file.description: The URL of the font file

list.description: A list of configurations

header_cart_notification_bg_color.description: The header cart notification background color

header_cart_notification_text_color.description: The header cart notification text color

button_add_to_cart_color.description: The add to cart button color

button_add_to_cart_label_color.description: The add to cart button label color

button_tertiary_hover_text_color.description: The tertiary button hover text color

disable_cart.description: Whether to disable the cart or not

is_menu_below_logo.description: Whether the menu is below the logo or not

industry.description: An array of industries associated with the theme

is_paid.description: Whether the theme is paid or not

notes.description: The release notes of the theme

desktop.description: The URL of the desktop image

mobile.description: The URL of the mobile image

The value of the text property.
The value of the checkbox property.
The value of the range property.

mobile.description: True if the screen is a mobile device.

desktop.description: True if the screen is a desktop device.

tablet.description: True if the screen is a tablet device.

authenticated.description: True if the user is authenticated.

anonymous.description: True if the user is anonymous.

exact_url.description: The exact URL of the route.

list.description: A list of configurations

ActionPage.description: Represents the page details used for rendering.

params.description: Parameters that should be considered in path.

items.description: A string parameter for the action.

query.description: Query parameter if any to be added to the action.

items.description: A string query parameter for the action.

PageType.description: The type of action such as product, products, category, brand.

status.description: Represents the status of the subscriber update operation.

message.description: Provides a message describing the result of the subscriber update operation.

Association.description: Configuration linking company, application, and extension data.

company_id.description: The identifier for the company associated with the configuration.

application_id.description: A list of application identifiers associated with the configuration.

extension_id.description: The identifier for the extension related to the configuration.

criteria.description: Defines the criteria for the association, including options for all events, empty criteria, or specific events.

type.description: Specifies the type of authentication used.

secret.description: Contains the key or token used for authentication.

topic.description: The topic associated with the broadcaster configuration.

queue.description: The queue name used by the broadcaster.

event_bridge_name.description: The name of the event bridge used in the broadcaster configuration.

workflow_name.description: The name of the workflow related to the broadcaster.

account_id.description: The account ID associated with the broadcaster configuration.

detail_type.description: Specifies the type of detail for the broadcaster, allowing for custom or non-enumerated values.

id.description: The unique identifier for the subscriber event mapping.

event_id.description: The identifier for the event associated with the subscriber.

subscriber_id.description: The identifier for the subscriber involved in the mapping.

reducer.description: The reducer property allows users to customize the JSON structure of the webhook payload using JSONPath queries. They can also create new properties by mapping existing ones. Note that it overrides the entire JSON structure of the webhook payload sent via the webhook. See the partner documentation's filter and reducer section for details.

created_on.description: The timestamp indicating when the subscriber event mapping was created.

FilterSchema.description: The filter property allows users to set up webhook filtering for a particular event by specifying a JSONPath query to extract a value from the payload and a condition to evaluate it. If the condition fails, the webhook is not sent. See the partner documentation's filter and reducer section for details. It can be used in below 2 modes: 1. Single condition mode: Includes `query` and `condition` to filter based on a JSONPath query and a JavaScript condition. 2. Logical group mode: Includes `logic` and an array of `conditions`, where each condition is itself a filter object. Note: Ensure that only one of these modes is used at a time.

query.description: JSONPath expression that specifies the property in the webhook payload to filter on. This enables targeting specific data within the payload.

condition.description: JavaScript function used to evaluate the specified property in the webhook payload against a condition. This function determines whether the filter passes based on its return value.

logic.description: Logical operator used to combine multiple conditions in the `conditions` array. Supported values are `AND` and `OR`.

conditions.description: An array of filter objects to be evaluated using the specified logical operator. This array will contain more filters including a combination of single condition mode and logical group mode filters.

id.description: The unique identifier for the event configuration.

event_name.description: The name assigned to the event configuration.

event_type.description: Specifies the type of event, allowing for custom or non-enumerated values.

event_category.description: Defines the category of the event, allowing for custom or non-enumerated values.

event_schema.description: Contains the schema details for the event, allowing for flexible or dynamic schemas.

version.description: The version number of the event configuration.

display_name.description: The display name for the event configuration.

description.description: A description of the event configuration, if provided.

created_on.description: The timestamp indicating when the event configuration was created.

updated_on.description: The timestamp indicating when the event configuration was last updated.

group.description: The group to which the event configuration belongs, if applicable.

items.description: A list of items representing subscriber configurations.

event_name.description: The name of the event that is considered invalid.

version.description: The version of the event that is considered invalid.

category.description: The category of the event that is considered invalid.

start_date.description: The start date and time for the period during which events were considered invalid.

end_date.description: The end date and time for the period during which events were considered invalid.

event_name.description: The name of the event that was found to be invalid.

event_type.description: The type of the invalid event, allowing for custom or non-enumerated values.

version.description: The version of the invalid event.

category.description: The category of the invalid event.

count.description: The number of occurrences of the invalid event.

events.description: A list of event types to filter the history report.

search_text.description: Text used for searching within the history report.

status.description: The status of the history report (e.g., "FAILED").

end_date.description: The end date and time of the history report.

start_date.description: The start date and time of the history report.

subscribers.description: An array of subscriber IDs associated with the history report.

webhook_type.description: An array of webhook types to identify the type of subscriber.

url.description: The URL of the uploaded report file.

name.description: The name of the uploaded report file.

CdnObject.description: Contains CDN details for uploaded files.

urls.description: A list of URLs for CDN objects, including the location of the uploaded report files.

UploadServiceObject.description: Represents the upload service containing CDN information.

HistoryAssociation.description: Links company and subscribers to a history report.

company_id.description: The identifier for the company associated with the history report.

subscriber_ids.description: A list of subscriber IDs related to the history report.

id.description: The unique identifier for the history report.

filename.description: The name of the file containing the history report.

status.description: The current status of the history report (e.g., "COMPLETED").

created_on.description: The date and time when the history report was generated.

updated_on.description: The date and time when the history report was last updated.

message.description: A message related to the history report.

items.description: A list of history report items.

company_id.description: The identifier for the company requesting the history report.

type.description: Specifies the type of history report requested (e.g., "platform").

page_no.description: The page number of the history report results.

page_size.description: The number of records to display per page in the history report.

message.description: A message indicating the result of the cancel download request.

result.description: The outcome of the cancel download operation.

filter_name.description: The name of the filter applied in the report.

values.description: A list of values resulting from the applied filter.

timestamp.description: The timestamp of the delivery event.

failed.description: The count of failed delivery attempts.

removed_webhooks.description: The count of removed webhooks during delivery.

success.description: The count of successful delivery attempts.

company_id.description: The identifier for the company requesting delivery details.

page_no.description: The page number for the delivery details results.

page_size.description: The number of records per page for delivery details.

start_date.description: The start date and time for filtering delivery details.

end_date.description: The end date and time for filtering delivery details.

event.description: A list of event delivery details.

status.description: The status of the delivery details request.

event_name.description: The name of the event related to the delivery details.

event_type.description: The type of the event, allowing for custom or non-enumerated values.

event_category.description: The category of the event, allowing for custom or non-enumerated values.

version.description: The version of the event related to the delivery details.

rows.description: A list of processed event reports with delivery details.

event_name.description: The name of the processed event.

response_code.description: The response code returned for the event, allowing for custom or non-enumerated values.

response_message.description: The response message associated with the event.

data.description: The data payload associated with the event.

attempt.description: The attempt number for processing the event.

last_attempted_on.description: The timestamp of the last attempt to process the event.

status.description: The status of the event processing (e.g., "FAILED").

webhook_url.description: The URL of the webhook associated with the event.

response_time.description: The time taken to respond to the event.

message_id.description: The identifier for the event message.

event_trace_id.description: The trace ID associated with the event.

event.description: The name or identifier of the event.

success.description: The count of successful deliveries for the event.

failed.description: The count of failed deliveries for the event.

failed_percentage.description: The percentage of failed deliveries relative to the total.

removed_webhooks.description: The count of webhooks that were removed during the delivery.

total.description: The total number of delivery attempts for the event.

response_time.description: The average response time for the event deliveries.

avg_response_time_ts.description: List of average response time timestamps.

last_attempted_on.description: The timestamp of the last attempt, formatted as a string.

response_code.description: The response code returned for the delivery attempt, allowing for custom or non-enumerated values.

response_time.description: The response time for the delivery attempt, formatted as a string.

attempt.description: The attempt number for the delivery.

total.description: The total count of deliveries attempted.

success.description: The total count of successful deliveries.

response_time.description: The average response time for deliveries.

removed_webhooks.description: The count of webhooks removed during delivery.

id.description: The unique identifier for the item.

modified_by.description: The user or system that last modified the item.

webhook_url.description: The URL of the webhook associated with the item.

custom_headers.description: Custom headers associated with the item, if any.

status.description: The current status of the item.

email_id.description: The email ID associated with the item, if applicable.

updated_on.description: The date and time when the item was last updated.

created_on.description: The date and time when the item was created.

type.description: The type of the item, if applicable.

event_configs.description: A list of event configurations associated with the item.

event_id.description: A list of event IDs associated with the item.

BlitzkriegApiError.description: API error. See the error object in the response body to know the exact reason.

BlitzkriegInternalServerError.description: Internal Server Error. See the error object in the response body to know the exact reason.

value.name: White-Splash
value.description: Kartmax is the perfect theme to get you started with your store. Capture audiences' attention through captivating layouts inspired by editorial design, striking typography, and impactful hero sections. Embrace a contemporary narrative that exudes personality and brings your content to life.

explore.title: Elevate Your Shopping Experience
explore.description: Designed to cater to extensive carts and inventories, featuring a prominent search bar and the choice for a permanently visible cart sidebar.

list.label: Video
list.description: Video as a section

list.label: Carousel
list.description: Carousel as a section

list.label: Standard Login Interface
list.description: Deafult Login Interface, use this if you have not implmented custom login interface for login, register flows inside your theme code.

list.label: Login with Email
list.description: This is be default available in Standard Login Interface. If custom login interface is used, check your implmentation.

list.label: Login with Mobile Number
list.description: This is be default available in Standard Login Interface. If custom login interface is used, check your implmentation.

list.label: Voice OTP
list.description: This is be default available in Standard Login Interface. If custom login interface is used, check your implmentation.

list.label: Social Media login
list.description: This is be default available in Standard Login Interface. If custom login interface is used, check your implmentation.

list.label: Guest Checkout
list.description: Enables customer to buy a product without login

list.label: Buy Now
list.description: Buy Now flow support along with Add to Cart

list.label: Product Videos
list.description: Videos present in product catalog can be shown

list.label: 3D Model of Product
list.description: 3D Models present in product catalog can be shown

list.label: Product Variants
list.description: Show variants of a particular product

list.label: Extension Support
list.description: Supports various extensions made for Prdouct Page

list.label: Default Size Selection
list.description: By default select one size

list.label: Product Highlights
list.description: Show highlights added in the cartalog

list.label: Short Description
list.description: Show short description from catalog in PDP

list.label: Infinite Scroll
list.description: Infinite scrolling support using lazy loady

list.label: Discount Badges
list.description: Show discount or custom badges on Product tiles

list.label: Product Variants
list.description: Supports showcase various variants on the listing itself

list.label: Customizable Navigation Menu
list.description: Customize Navigation Menu to accomodate multiple desings

list.label: alt text
list.description: Alt text data received in API is used on Product Images

highlights.title: Styles and Colours
highlights.description: With custom colours and styles, you can modify the appearance of your entire store or particular sections for specific events, marketing drives, or whenever des

highlights.title: Enhanced Navigation and Menu:
highlights.description: Unleash the full potential of your header by showcasing images, videos, products, and collections in an enhanced dropdown menu. Improve the browsing experience

meta.description: Indulge in the epitome of luxury with our expertly crafted theme, showcasing a high-end aesthetic that exudes elegance. Designed with meticulous attention to detail, our features are tailored to elevate your products and amplify your brand identity.
